data.enText: tries
trying
tried
tried

data.chText: 试图；想要；设法；努力
data.enText: to make an attempt or effort to do or get sth

data.chText: 我不知道是否能来，但我尽可能来。
data.enText: I don't know if I can come but I'll try.

data.chText: 你想要做什么？
data.enText: What are you trying to do?

data.chText: 我强忍住不笑出来。
data.enText: I tried hard not to laugh.

data.chText: 她尽了最大的努力解决这个问题。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She tried her best to solve the problem.

data.chText: 请尽力而为吧。
data.enText: Just try your hardest .

data.text: In spoken English try can be used with and plus another verb, instead of with to and the infinitive:

data.enText: I'll try and get you a new one tomorrow.
Try and finish quickly.

data.text: In this structure, only the form try can be used, not tries , trying or tried .
英语口语中，try可以和and加另一动词连用，而不和to及动词不定式连用：I'll try and get you a new one tomorrow./ Try and finish quickly.在这一结构中，只能用try的形式，而不能用tries、trying或tried。

data.chText: 试；试用；试做；试验
data.enText: to use, do or test sth in order to see if it is good, suitable, etc.

data.chText: 你尝过这种新咖啡吗？好极啦。
data.enText: Have you tried this new coffee? It's very good.

data.chText: “你想尝点儿生鱼片吗？”“好哇，我什么都想尝一点儿！”
data.enText: ‘Would you like to try some raw fish?’ ‘Why not? I'll try anything once !’

data.chText: 你玩过帆板运动吗？
data.enText: Have you ever tried windsurfing?

data.chText: 试试这双鞋的大小，你穿应该合脚。
data.enText: Try these shoes for size ─they should fit you.

data.chText: 她推了推那扇门，但门锁着。
data.enText: She tried the door, but it was locked.

data.chText: 约翰不在这儿。给他家里打电话试试看。
data.enText: John isn't here. Try phoning his home number.

data.text: Notice the difference between try to do sth and try doing sth :

data.enText: You should try to eat more fruit.

data.text: means ‘You should make an effort to eat more fruit.’;

data.enText: You should try eating more fruit.

data.text: means ‘You should see if eating more fruit will help you (to feel better, for example).’
注意try to do sth和try doing sth的区别：You should try to eat more fruit.意思是你应该尽量多吃些水果。而You should try eating more fruit.意思是你应该试试多吃水果，看身体会否好些。

data.chText: 审理；审讯；审判
data.enText: to examine evidence in court and decide whether sb is innocent or guilty

data.chText: 他因谋杀罪而受审。
data.enText: He was tried for murder.

data.chText: 此案是由陪审团参加审理的。
data.enText: The case was tried before a jury.
not for want/lack of trying

data.chText: 并非努力不够；已经尽力了
data.enText: used to say that although sb has not succeeded in sth, they have tried very hard

data.chText: 他们还没赢过一场比赛，但并不是由于拼劲不足。
data.enText: They haven't won a game yet, but it isn't for want of trying.
try your hand (at sth)

data.chText: 初试身手
data.enText: to do sth such as an activity or a sport for the first time
try it on (with sb)

data.chText: 对…粗野无礼；耍弄；向…行骗
data.enText: to behave badly towards sb or try to get sth from them, even though you know this will make them angry

data.chText: 儿童经常设法戏弄新来的老师。
data.enText: Children often try it on with new teachers.

data.chText: 试图与（某人）发生性关系
data.enText: to try to start a sexual relationship with sb
try your luck (at sth)

data.chText: 碰运气
data.enText: to do sth that involves risk or luck, hoping to succeed

data.chText: 我的祖父母移民到加拿大去碰碰运气。
data.enText: My grandparents emigrated to Canada to try their luck there.
try sb's patience

data.chText: 使忍无可忍；使不耐烦
data.enText: to make sb feel impatient
do/try your level best (to do sth)

data.chText: 尽自己最大的努力；竭尽全力；全力以赴
data.enText: to do as much as you can to try to achieve sth
these things are sent to try us

data.chText: （表示无法改变，应该接受）这些都是对我们的考验／磨炼
data.enText: used to say that you should accept an unpleasant situation or event because you cannot change it
try for sth

data.chText: 试图获得；力争赢得
data.enText: to make an attempt to get or win sth
try sth↔on

data.chText: 试穿（衣物）
data.enText: to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits and how it looks

data.chText: 鞋子要先穿上试一试再买。
data.enText: Try the shoes on before you buy them.
try out for sth

data.chText: 参加…选拔（或试演）
data.enText: to compete for a position or place in sth, or to be a member of a team

data.chText: 她正在参加学校戏剧演员甄选。
data.enText: She's trying out for the school play.
try sb/sth↔out (on sb)

data.chText: 试用（某人）；测试；试验
data.enText: to test or use sb/sth in order to see how good or effective they are

data.chText: 他们正在为这个节目试用一名新的主持人。
data.enText: They're trying out a new presenter for the show.
tries

data.chText: 尝试；试图；努力
data.enText: an act of trying to do sth

data.chText: 我不敢肯定他们能够帮得上忙，但不妨试一试。
data.enText: I doubt they'll be able to help but it's worth a try (= worth asking them) .

data.chText: 为什么你不试试说服他？
data.enText: Why don't you have a try at convincing him?

data.chText: 我不认为我有打网球的特长，但是我会试一试。
data.enText: I don't think I'll be any good at tennis, but I'll give it a try .

data.chText: “看你身后是什么？”“好个鬼花招，不过你耍的手法还不够高明！”
data.enText: ‘What's that behind you?’ ‘ Nice try (= at making me turn round) , but you'll have to do better than that!’

data.chText: 美国的谈判者决定再作一番努力，力争达成和解。
data.enText: The US negotiators decided to make another try at reaching a settlement.

data.chText: 在对方球门线后带球触地；持球触地得分
data.enText: an act of scoring points by touching the ground behind your opponents' goal line with the ball

data.chText: 带球触地得分
data.enText: to score a try

word_means: 在对方球门线后带球触地

means: 在对方球门线后带球触地

do/try your damnedest (to do sth)

data.enText: to try as hard as you can (to do sth)

data.chText: 她竭尽全力按时把它完成了。
data.enText: She did her damnedest to get it done on time.
do/try your level best (to do sth)

data.enText: to do as much as you can to try to achieve sth

data.enText: to make an attempt to get or win sth

data.chText: 试用（某人）；测试；试验
data.enText: to test or use sb/sth in order to see how good or effective they are

data.chText: 他们正在为这个节目试用一名新的主持人。
data.enText: They're trying out a new presenter for the show.

tr: earnest and conscientious activity intended to do or accomplish something
example: made an effort to cover all the reading material
wished him luck in his endeavor
she gave it a good try

tr: put on a garment in order to see whether it fits and looks nice
example: Try on this sweater to see how it looks

tr: melt (fat or lard) in order to separate out impurities
example: try the yak butter
render fat in a casserole
Try these new crackers
Sample the regional dishes
You are trying my patience!
I've been sorely tried by these students

tr: examine or hear (evidence or a case) by judicial process
example: The jury had heard all the evidence
The case will be tried in California

tr: put on trial or hear a case and sit as the judge at the trial of
example: The football star was tried for the murder of his wife
The judge tried both father and son in separate trials
He tried to shake off his fears
The infant had essayed a few wobbly steps
The police attempted to stop the thief
He sought to improve himself
She always seeks to do good in the world

tr: put to the test, as for its quality, or give experimental use to
example: This approach has been tried with good results
Test this recipe

value.def: If you try to do something, you want to do it, and you take action which you hope will help you to do it.

example.ex: He secretly tried to block her advancement in the Party...
example.tran: 他暗地里设法阻挠她在党内的晋升。

example.ex: Try to make the effort to work your way through all of your tasks one at a time…
example.tran: 争取努力把你所有的任务一次完成一项。

example.ex: Does it annoy you if others do things less well than you would, or don't seem to try hard enough?...
example.tran: 如果别人不如你能干，或者似乎不够努力，你会很生气吗？

example.ex: I tried calling him when I got here but he wasn't at home...
example.tran: 我到这里时试着给他打电话，但他不在家。

example.ex: No matter how bad you feel, keep trying.
example.tran: 不管你感觉多么糟糕，继续努力。

example.ex: It wasn't that she'd really expected to get any money out of him; it had just seemed worth a try...
example.tran: 她并不是真指望能从他那里得到钱，只是觉得值得一试。

example.ex: After a few tries Patrick had given up any attempt to reform his brother.
example.tran: 几次尝试之后，帕特里克放弃了改造弟弟的任何努力。

value.def: To try and do something means to try to do it.

example.ex: He has started a privatisation programme to try and win support from the business community…
example.tran: 他启动了一套私有化方案，以设法赢得商界的支持。

example.ex: I must try and see him.
example.tran: 我必须设法见到他。

value.def: If you try for something, you make an effort to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: My partner and I have been trying for a baby for two years...
example.tran: 我和爱人两年来一直想要个孩子。

example.ex: He said he was going to try for first place next year.
example.tran: 他说他明年会争取夺得第一名。

value.def: If you try something new or different, you use it, do it, or experience it in order to discover its qualities or effects.

example.ex: It's best not to try a new recipe for the first time on such an important occasion...
example.tran: 在这么重要的场合最好不要尝试以前从未做过的新菜谱。

example.ex: I've tried everything from herbal cigarettes to chewing gum…
example.tran: 中草药香烟、口香糖之类的我统统都试过了。

example.ex: I have tried painting the young shoots with weed poisoner, but this does not kill them off.
example.tran: 我试过在小嫩芽上涂除草剂，但这并没有将它们除净。

example.ex: If you're still sceptical about exercising, we can only ask you to trust us and give it a try.
example.tran: 如果你对锻炼还有疑虑，我们只能要求你相信我们，亲自试一试。

value.def: If you try a particular place or person, you go to that place or person because you think that they may be able to provide you with what you want.

example.ex: Have you tried the local music shops?
example.tran: 你到当地的音像店找过了吗？

value.tran: 到(某处)试试;找(某人)试试

value.def: If you try a door or window, you try to open it.

example.ex: Bob tried the door. To his surprise it opened.
example.tran: 鲍勃试着推了推门。令他吃惊的是，门竟然开了。

value.def: When a person is tried, he or she has to appear in a law court and is found innocent or guilty after the judge and jury have heard the evidence. When a legal case is tried, it is considered in a court of law.

example.ex: He suggested that those responsible should be tried for crimes against humanity...
example.tran: 他建议那些责任人应该以反人类罪受到审判。

example.ex: Whether he is innocent or guilty is a decision that will be made when the case is tried in court...
example.tran: 他有罪与否，等案件在法庭受审后就会作出判决。

example.ex: The military court which tried him excluded two of his lawyers...
example.tran: 审判他的军事法庭拒绝让他的两位律师出庭辩护。

example.ex: Why does it take 253 days to try a case of fraud?
example.tran: 为什么审讯一宗欺诈案要花 253 天时间？

value.def: In the game of rugby, a try is the action of scoring by putting the ball down behind the goal line of the opposing team.

example.ex: The French, who led 21-3 at half time, scored eight tries.
example.tran: 上半场以 21:3 领先的法国队有 8 个达阵得分。

value.tran: (橄榄球的)达阵得分(在对方球门线内带球触地得分)

value.boxu_tran: 英语口语中常用try and代替try to，但在书面语中应避免这种用法。如，Just try and stop me (你拦我试试看)。注意try to与try加动词ing形式的区别，后者经常表示建议做某事。如，I'm going to try to open a jammed door (我要设法打开一扇卡住的门)，Try opening the windows to freshen the air (试着把窗子打开，透透气）。
value.boxu_usage: Try and is often used instead of try to in spoken English, but you should avoid it in writing. Just try and stop me! Notice also the difference between try to and try with the '-ing' form of the verb, which often suggests doing something. I'm going to try to open a jammed door… Try opening the windows to freshen the air.

value.def: If you say that something fails but not for want of trying or not for lack of trying, you mean that everything possible was done to make it succeed.

example.ex: Not all is perfect, but it isn't for want of trying.
example.tran: 一切并非无可挑剔，但已经竭尽全力了。

gramarinfo.label: with neg, <l>it</l> v-link PHR, PHR with cl

value.tran: 没努力尝试;没竭尽全力

trans: 我尝试；我努力；我嘗試；试试看；我试试看
不错的尝试；很好的尝试；想得美；得了吧
